discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
https://docs.fortinet.com/document/fortigate/7.0.9/cli-reference/511620/config-user-radius
look for "auth-type" , there is no EAP option.
correct answer is D.

questions.question_text: Which authentication option can you not configure under config user radius on FortiOS?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
https://community.fortinet.com/t5/FortiGate/Technical-Tip-Explaining-the-diagnose-hard-sysinfo-memory/ta-p/294211
D is false because the documentation states that "Inactive" represents memory used for processes that were not recently active. "Inactive(file)" represents buffer/cache memory which is free. The "Inactive" value itself doesn't directly represent unused cache pages.
Correct answer is BC.

choices.B: The user space has 708880 kB of physical memory that is not used by the system.
choices.D: The value indicated next to the Inactive heading represents the currently unused cache page.
choices.C: The I/O cache, which has 641364 kB of memory allocated to it.
choices.A: There are 98909 kB of memory that will never be used.
If a configuration change is made to the primary FortiGate at this time, the secondary will initiate a synchronization reset.
choices.D: If no action is taken, the primary FortiGate will leave the cluster because of the current sync status.
choices.B: If port7 becomes disconnected on the secondary, both FortiGate devices will elect itself as primary.
choices.C: If FGVM…649 is rebooted, FGVM…650 will become the primary and retain that role, even after FGVM…649 rejoins the cluster.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
correct answer is BC.
A is incorrect because a normal config change on the primary does not trigger a “synchronization reset”; it simply propagates to the secondary.

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit, which shows the output of get system ha status.

//IMG//


NGFW-1 and NGFW-2 have been up for a week.

Which two statements about the output are true? (Choose two.)

choices.B: NP7 is handling offloading of this session.
choices.A: The traffic has been tagged for VLAN 0000.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
i can see "policy_id=1", indicating that the session matches Policy ID 1. 
also "ips_offload=1" and "offload=8/8" means that this session has been offloaded to the NPU
so i think the correct answer is CD.

choices.C: User A: Pass. The default static route through wan1 passes the RPF check regardless of the source IP address.
choices.B: User B: Fail. There is no route to 95.56.234.24 using wan2 in the routing table.
choices.E: User C: Fail. There is no route to 10.0.4.63 using port1 in the routing table.
choices.D: User B: Pass. FortiGate will use asymmetric routing using wan1 to reply to traffic for 95.56.234.24
choices.A: Strict RPF is enabled by default.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BCE
i think correct answer is BCE.
"A" is not correct - you can search in the CLI Reference for FortiOS and see that "strict-src-check" is disabled by default which means it selects 'feasible path' behaviour and not 'strict' behaviour.
